title: WCAS SLAVIC 303-2-1 Modern Russian Readings and Language

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Slavic 303-2 is the second part in a three-quarter sequence designed to improve your speaking and writing ability from the word and sentence to the paragraph-length discourse. You will continue to move from conversing about concrete subjects to discussing more abstract ones (expressing opinions, arguing a point, etc.) Special attention is given to strengthening your knowledge of Russian grammar as well as to developing higher reading and listening comprehension skills. A basic goal continues to be further development of your ability to communicate in Russian and of your knowledge of Russian culture.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Gain confidence and practice speaking about abstract, rather than concrete, topics. Expand speaking abilities to paragraph and paragraphs level from sentence levels. Advanced level Russian grammar. Work on gaining advanced levels in Russian for listening, reading, and writing, as well.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Brief lecture, discussions, pairs work, homework.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Quizzes, unit tests, final exam, homework, essays
